cities.Name: Paris
cities.blurb: Paris was an incredible vacation destination because it has such a rich history, stunning architecture, and a vibrant cultural scene. Of course, we visited the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre. I love art, and what better place to be than France? I got to see the Mona Lisa painting, the Venus de Milo statue, and various well-known Renaissance artworks. Every corner of the city felt like a postcard. The cuisine was unparalleled—we tried everything from fresh-baked croissants to Michelin-starred dining experiences. We also rode a boat down the Seine River and saw a show at the amazing Moulin Rouge. Why did they let me inside? I don’t know; European age laws are crazy, but Paris delivered unforgettable moments at every turn.

cities.Name: San Maurizio d'Opaglio
cities.blurb: San Maurizio d'Opaglio is a hidden gem in northern Italy. Being there felt so tranquil. It is situated near Lake Orta and it offers breathtaking views. It was a lovely and peaceful escape from crowded tourist hotspots. San Maurizio d'Opaglio is known for its artisanal craftsmanship and connection to nature as you can see from the photo. The town felt warm and welcoming. We were able to explore the location and indulge in local fresh Italian cuisine.

cities.Name: Rome
cities.blurb: Rome was one of the locations where I felt starstruck. It felt like I was stepping into a living museum. It offers a journey through time unlike any other city. From the Colosseum and Roman Forum, where you can see the echoes of ancient civilizations, to the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City, every corner of Rome told a story. One of my favorite moments was walking through the streets because it was a mix of vibrant modern life and centuries-old locations. Tossing a coin into the Trevi Fountain was a must. The city's timeless beauty, cultural richness, and warm, welcoming spirit make it a place I’ll always want to revisit.

cities.Name: Zurich
cities.blurb: Zurich is nestled in the heart of Switzerland. This city offers a harmonious blend of natural beauty and modern elegance. The city is near the shores of Lake Zurich which provides breathtaking views of crystal-clear waters. Strolling along the lake's promenade, you can see the sailboats drift by and swans glide across the water. Landmarks like the Grossmünster and Fraumünster churches not only showcase the beautiful architecture, but also tell stories of Zurich's rich past. The public transportation system is efficient and eco-friendly, making it easy to explore the city and its surroundings without a car.

cities.Name: Madrid
cities.blurb: Madrid was our last destination before returning home. We weren’t able to do much here since we only had a few hours until our departure, but we still got to experience some of what Madrid has to offer, like the Reina Sofía Museum, which houses art by Picasso. One of my favorite locations was the Santiago Bernabéu Stadium, where Real Madrid plays. They have been my childhood soccer team, and one day, I hope to go back and see a Real Madrid home game there.
